instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00034: What is 820-00034? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.3V3_S4: What is 3V3_S4? This is an abbreviation of PP3V3_S4, a 3.3v power rail when the machine is in an S4 state. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4L: What is PM_SLP_S4L? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4L, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
just first led is on-STABLE.
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3v and stay stable when i trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>. i was replaced SMC but the same.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> pulsing 3.3v-0v when i trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> on L7610 3.3V stable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> pulsing 3.3v-0v when i trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>."
Do you mean that <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> is present BEFORE pressing power button?

Check <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
Do you mean that <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> is present BEFORE pressing power button? yes, its 3.3v stable. but no 2# led.
<SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 0v
can find  <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> on boardview there is just  <SIGNAL>NC_SMC_S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and its under SMC chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
If CMOS cell is removed, board will try to start when power supply is connected.
However, you should get more voltages, not only S4.

"can find  <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> on boardview" (you've probably meant can't).
What about <SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD_REG_P3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?
When you look at schematic, try to understand what you see there.
Also be aware, sometime name differences appear between schematic and boardview.
This shouldn't be a problem for a technician.

When <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> is there, check <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> level (before pressing power button).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>,  <SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD_REG_P3V3_S5</SIGNAL> all 3 look like they acting the same, all 3 a 3.3V and pulsing when i trigger SMC but not always.
<SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> 0V"
You've said to get 3V before.

Also I don't see any mention about <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL>, as I asked.

<SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> shouldn't drop when you trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q6970</TRANSISTOR>, if note it drops.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message: sorry  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> is0v <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> is 3.3V

i dont have where to get from new <TRANSISTOR>Q6970</TRANSISTOR> but i was take it out and connect D to S (<SIGNAL>PP12V_G3H</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>PP12V_S5</SIGNAL>)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
Looks like SMC issue.
Once <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is high, SMC must release <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.
Did you solder SMC pulled from same model board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message: Not from the same model board, but it’s look the same chip, is it different?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
After two years on the forum still have doubts about SMC replacement?
Get the correct SMC for this board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led

I will get one..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
some update,
i was get "new" board, install it and it was work great for 2 days...suddenly it was not turn on, i was open it and now just one led on, when i press power button the #2 led turn on for half second and off(like is short or something) <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> 0v when i press power button it jump to 0.8v and back to 0v.
very weird!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
Try changing <TRANSISTOR>Q8450</TRANSISTOR>.
Check for short on any S3, or S0 power rail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8450</TRANSISTOR>
no short on S3 and S0 rails..
still the same..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
If LE032 flashes, means <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is pulsing.
So all voltages controlled by <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3L</SIGNAL> should pulse too.
Check them all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3L</SIGNAL> and of course also  <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>  pulse when i trigger on/off. 0v-0.5v
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> is 3.4v when i trigger on/off is down to 0v and up again(normal)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
Then you should get pulse on all S3 and S0 voltages (at same time).
Same behavior without RAM?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00034</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> imac 21" 1#led
threads.message:
Check RTC signals.
Also change CMOS battery, just in case.
